reviews.review_msg: Quite possibly the worst teacher Ive ever encountered. So disorganized, makes no attempt at teaching from the basics onward. Completely confusing. DO NOT TAKE THIS MANS CLASSES. Hes a hack.

Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.  He spent 25 minutes during the first day of lecture teaching his students how to pronounce his name properly. The Lectures are always a lesson late, the TA's are practically invisible and you'll only come out of lecture just as confused as Jorge is. (he thought 0.01 is equivalent to 10%)
Boring and wildy disorganized. He genuinely seems like w nice guy but damn, he's god awful as a teacher.   ive had 20+ profs so far. He is the worst prof if I had in terms of their ability to teach.
Class is extremely easy, notes are easy to take and very clear. He makes Stats seem fun, so much so that I almost wanted to add it in as a minor. Skills learned are easily transferable to a resume.

All I did was study a nite before each midterm and final and got an A without attending class. Everything you needed to know for exams was straight out of the book.  The info was so simple and strait forward that there was no need to even attend class.

Wendell is the most confusing person in the world.  He will have a two hour lecture on equations and stats and really tough things that arent in the textbook, then right when youre about to leave he says "but thats beyond this course".... like why tell us then? He talks really quickly and no one pays attention and it is hard to focus. thumbs down.

Decent prof, but her overall demeanour was awful. She was condescending, rude, and literally kicked me out of her class in front of hundreds of students for coming in late. Lectures bland, just make sure you to the homework and study for the midterms, even though they are open book.

He is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. He's a pretty funny guy and he definitely made me want to go to class. I thought I'd do poorly in a stats class but he taught it really well so it was easy. Always do practice questions from the textbook because a lot of them were on his exams.

Fair teacher, exams are based on his practice questions, so you better do them! Gives a lot of hints for exams in class, so it's best to attend class. Bingham makes stats that much more interesting and much more bearable. If you're taking stats, MUST take it with him!
Kind of boring... I mean stats is not the most exciting field but going to the two hour lecture was really hard!

Harsha was a great prof. No one really wants to take stats and it is usually a requirement. Harsha teaches as if you have never learned any stats ever (which most of us haven't) The best prof to take if you need this requirement of an intro stat. A dreaded and challenging course is taught in great manner! Exam averages are usually 75%

For a 100 level course this class was extremely difficult I found.  There were numerous homework assignments and Scott was unclear in lectures.  He is a very nice man, but quite unflexible and demanding.  I did not enjoy this course or would recommend to anyone who can avoid taking it with him.  It sucked, I hated it.
